tidbits.title: Small Island Nation
tidbits.description: Nauru is one of the world's smallest independent nations, located in the Pacific Ocean, known for its phosphate mining history.

tidbits.title: Environmental Challenges
tidbits.description: The country faces environmental challenges due to past phosphate mining, affecting its land and leading to ongoing sustainability efforts.

tidbits.title: Cultural Heritage
tidbits.description: Nauru's cultural heritage is preserved through traditional music, dances, and art, reflecting its Polynesian and Micronesian influences.
